org.apache.drill.test

Class ClusterFixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.test.BaseFixture
      • org.apache.drill.test.ClusterFixture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClusterMockStorageFixture

    public class ClusterFixture
extends BaseFixture
implements AutoCloseable
    Test fixture to start a Drillbit with provide options, create a client, and execute queries. Can be used in JUnit tests, or in ad-hoc programs. Provides a builder to set the necessary embedded Drillbit and client options, then creates the requested Drillbit and client.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ClusterFixture.FixtureTestServices
      Shim class to allow the TestBuilder class to work with the cluster fixture.

      • client

        public ClientFixture client(String host,
                            int port)
        Create a test client for a specific host and port.
        Parameters:
        host - host, must be one of those created by this fixture
        port - post, must be one of those created by this fixture
        Returns:
        a test client. Client will be closed when this cluster fixture closes, or can be closed early

      • restClientFixture

        public RestClientFixture restClientFixture()

      • client

        public DrillClient client()

      • jdbcConnection

        public Connection jdbcConnection()
        Return a JDBC connection to the default (first) Drillbit. Note that this code requires special setup of the test code. Tests in the "exec" package do not normally have visibility to the Drill JDBC driver. So, the test must put that code on the class path manually in order for this code to load the JDBC classes. The caller is responsible for closing the JDBC connection before closing the cluster. (An enhancement is to do the close automatically as is done for clients.)
        Returns:
        a JDBC connection to the default Drillbit

      • close

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        Close the clients, Drillbits, allocator and Zookeeper. Checks for exceptions. If an exception occurs, continues closing, suppresses subsequent exceptions, and throws the first exception at completion of close. This allows the test code to detect any state corruption which only shows itself when shutting down resources (memory leaks, for example.)
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception

      • defineWorkspace

        public void defineWorkspace(String pluginName,
                            String schemaName,
                            String path,
                            String defaultFormat)
        Define a workspace within an existing storage plugin. Useful for pointing to local file system files outside the Drill source tree.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - name of the plugin like "dfs".
        schemaName - name of the new schema
        path - directory location (usually local)
        defaultFormat - default format for files in the schema

      • builder

        public static ClusterFixtureBuilder builder(BaseDirTestWatcher dirTestWatcher)

      • bareBuilder

        public static ClusterFixtureBuilder bareBuilder(BaseDirTestWatcher dirTestWatcher)
        Return a cluster builder without any of the usual defaults. Use this only for special cases. Your code is responsible for all the odd bits that must be set to get the setup right. See TEST_CONFIGURATIONS for details. Note that you are often better off using the defaults, then replacing selected properties with the values you prefer.
        Returns:
        a fixture builder with no default properties set

      • standardCluster

        public static ClusterFixture standardCluster(BaseDirTestWatcher dirTestWatcher)
        Return a cluster fixture built with standard options. This is a short-cut for simple tests that don't need special setup.
        Parameters:
        dirTestWatcher - directory test watcher
        Returns:
        a cluster fixture with standard options

      • stringify

        public static String stringify(Object value)
        Convert a Java object (typically a boxed scalar) to a string for use in SQL. Quotes strings but just converts others to string format. If value to encode is null, return null.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to encode
        Returns:
        the SQL-acceptable string equivalent

      • getResource

        public static String getResource(String resource)
                          throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • loadResource

        public static String loadResource(String resource)
        Load a resource file, returning the resource as a string. "Hides" the checked exception as unchecked, which is fine in a test as the unchecked exception will fail the test without unnecessary error fiddling.
        Parameters:
        resource - path to the resource
        Returns:
        the resource contents as a string

      • trimSlash

        public static String trimSlash(String path)
        Guava likes paths to resources without an initial slash, the JDK needs a slash. Normalize the path when needed.
        Parameters:
        path - resource path with optional leading slash
        Returns:
        same path without the leading slash

      • makeDataDir

        public File makeDataDir(String key,
                        String defaultFormat,
                        FormatPluginConfig formatPluginConfig)
        Create a temporary data directory which will be removed when the cluster closes, and register it as a "dfs" name space.
        Parameters:
        key - The name to use for the directory and the name space. Access the directory as "dfs.".
        defaultFormat - The default storage format for the workspace.
        formatPluginConfig - The format plugin config.
        Returns:
        location of the directory which can be used to create temporary input files

        public File getDrillTempDir()

        public boolean usesZK()

      • getProfileDir

        public File getProfileDir()
        Returns the directory that holds query profiles. Valid only for an embedded Drillbit with local cluster coordinator – the normal case for unit tests.
        Returns:
        query profile directory
